e5: A reporting policy can be viewed as ethical when it promotes transparency, honesty, and fairness. An ethics-friendly policy might provide clear and consistent guidelines for financial reporting, avoiding biases that could mislead investors or obscure material information. Additionally, transparency about the rationale behind any adjustments to earnings, such as the 50-cent bias at ABC, is crucial. In this case, changing the policy without adequate disclosure or consideration of potential impacts on investors may undermine trust and lead to increased scrutiny by regulatory bodies like the SEC. Open communication with stakeholders can help maintain trust.
e6: Yes, I would have additional follow-up questions to clarify some concerns.
